questions.question_text: In throwing a fair dice, what is the probability of getting the number '3'?
What is the chance of throwing a number greater than 4 with an ordinary dice whose faces are numbered from 1 to 6?
Find the chance of throwing at least one ace (one) in a simple throw with two dice.
Find the chance of drawing 2 blue balls in succession from a bag containing 5 red and 7 blue balls, if the balls are not being replaced.
From a pack of 52 cards, two are drawn at random. Find the chance that one is a knave and the other a queen.
If a card is picked up at random from a pack of 52 cards. Find the probability that it is a spade.
If a card is picked up at random from a pack of 52 cards. Find the probability that it is a king or queen.
If a card is picked up at random from a pack of 52 cards. Find the probability that it is a spade or king or queen.
Three coins are tossed. What is the probability of getting 2 Tails and 1 Head?
Three coins are tossed. What is the probability of getting 1 Tail and 2 Heads?
Three coins are tossed. What is the probability of getting neither 3 Heads nor 3 Tails?
Three coins are tossed. What is the probability of getting three Heads?
Three coins are tossed. What is the probability that there is at least one Tail?
Two fair dice are thrown. Find the probability that the sum of the faces is divisible by 2 or 4.
Two fair dice are thrown. Find the probability that the sum of the faces is divisible by 2 and 4.
Two fair dice are thrown. Find the probability that the sum of the faces is a prime number less than 8.
A bag contains 3 green and 7 white balls. Two balls are drawn without replacement. Probability that both are white?
A bag contains 3 green and 7 white balls. Two balls are drawn without replacement. Probability they are of different colours?
100 students appeared for two examinations. 60 passed first, 50 passed second, 30 passed both. Probability a student failed both?
What is the probability of throwing a number greater than 2 with a fair dice?
Three cards numbered 2, 4, 8 are put into a box. If one is drawn, probability it's a prime number?
From a box containing cards numbered 2, 4, and 8, if one is drawn, find the probability that the card drawn is even.
From a box containing cards numbered 2, 4, and 8, if one is drawn, find the probability that the card drawn is odd.
Two fair coins are tossed. Find the probability of obtaining 2 Heads.
Two fair coins are tossed. Find the probability of obtaining 1 Head and 1 Tail.
Two fair coins are tossed. Find the probability of obtaining 2 Tails.
In rolling two dices, find the probability that there is at least one '6'.
In rolling two dices, find the probability that the sum is 5.
From a bag containing 4 white and 5 black balls, 3 are drawn at random. What are the odds against all being black?
Amit throws three dice in Ludo. If he needs 15 or higher to win, find his chance of winning.
Probability of forming the number 187 or 215 with three distinct digits chosen from 1-9 (no repetition).
A three-digit number is formed using the digits 1-9, with repetition allowed. Find the probability that the number formed is 187 or 215.
In a horse race (18 horses), the probability of horses 1, 2, and 3 winning are P(1)=1/6, P(2)=1/10, P(3)=1/8. Find the probability that one of them wins (assuming mutually exclusive events).
Two balls are drawn from a bag with 8 green and 13 blue balls. Find the chance that both are blue.
Two fair dice are thrown. Probability of throwing a double?
Two fair dice are thrown. Find the probability that the sum is greater than 10?
Two fair dice are thrown. Find the probability that the sum is less than 10?
In a lottery with a ₹1 crore prize and 5000 tickets, a man holds 10 tickets. What is his expectation value?
Two letters are chosen at random from the letters of the word LIME. Find the probability that they are L and M.
A bag contains 4 black and 5 red balls. 3 are chosen randomly. Find the chance that all are black.
A two-digit number is formed from the digits 2, 3, 5, 7, 9 (no repetition). Find the probability that the number formed is 35.
From a pack of 52 cards, 3 are drawn at random. Find the probability of getting a King, a Queen, and a Jack.
A bag contains balls numbered 1–20. If one ball is drawn, find the probability that the number on it is a multiple of 5 or 7.
In a sample of 1972 children: 1000 boys and 972 girls. Based on this data, what is the probability that a newborn is a girl?
A bag contains 3 red, 6 white, and 7 black balls. Two are drawn at random. Find the probability that both are black.
A bag contains 6 red, 4 white, and 8 blue balls. Three are drawn at random. Find the probability that all three are the same colour.
A bag contains 6 red, 4 white, and 8 blue balls. Three are drawn at random. Find the probability that all three are blue.
Given P(A)=0.5 and P(A∩B)≤0.3. Can P(B) be equal to 0.9?
The probability of a student passing Mathematics is 3/5, passing English is 1/3, and passing both is 1/8. Find the probability that the student passes at least one subject.

The odds in favour of standing first of three students Amit, Vikas and Vivek appearing at an examination are 1:2, 2:5 and 1:7 respectively. What is the probability that either of them will stand first (assume that a tie for the first place is not possible)?
A, B, C are three mutually exclusive and exhaustive events associated with a random experiment. Find P(A) if it is given that P(B) = 3/2 P(A) and P(C) = 1/2 P(B).
A and B are two mutually exclusive events of an experiment. If P(A') = 0.65, P(A ∪ B) = 0.65 and P(B) = p, find the value of p.
A bag contains 4 white and 2 black balls. Another bag contains 3 white and 5 black balls. If one ball is drawn from each bag, find the probability that both are white.
A bag contains 4 white and 2 black balls. Another bag contains 3 white and 5 black balls. If one ball is drawn from each bag, find the probability that both are black.
A bag contains 4 white and 2 black balls. Another bag contains 3 white and 5 black balls. If one ball is drawn from each bag, find the probability that one is white and one is black.
The odds against an event A is 5:3 and the odds in favour of another independent event B is 7:5. Find the probability that at least one of the two events will occur.

Kamal and Monica appeared for an interview for two vacancies. The probability of Kamal's selection is 1/3 and that of Monica's selection is 1/5. Find the probability that only one of them will be selected.

A husband and a wife appear in an interview for two vacancies for the same post. The probability of husband's selection is 1/7 and that of the wife's selection is 1/5. Find the probability that both of them will be selected.
The probability of a husband's selection is 1/7 and that of his wife's selection is 1/5 for two vacancies. Find the probability that only one of them will be selected.
The probability of a husband's selection is 1/7 and that of his wife's selection is 1/5 for two vacancies. Find the probability that none of them will be selected.
The probability of a husband's selection is 1/7 and that of his wife's selection is 1/5 for two vacancies. Find the probability that at least one of them will be selected.
Two fair dice are thrown. Given that the sum of the dice is less than or equal to 4, find the probability that only one dice shows two.
A can hit the target 3 times in 6 shots, B 2 times in 4 times and C 4 times in 6 shots. They fire a volley. What is the probability that at least 2 shots hit?

There are two bags, one of them contains 5 red and 7 white balls and the other 3 red and 12 white balls, and a ball is to be drawn from one or the other of the two bags. Find the chance of drawing a red ball.
If two cards are drawn one after another with replacement from a pack of 52 cards, find the probability that both are kings.
If two cards are drawn one after another without replacement from a pack of 52 cards, find the probability that both are kings.
From a pack of 52 cards, 3 cards are drawn at random. Find the probability that they are a king, a queen and a jack.
A box contains 5 red, 6 white and 7 black balls. Two balls are drawn at random. Find the probability that they are of the same colour.
The probability that A hits a target is 1/4 and the probability that B hits a target is 1/3. Find the probability that the target is hit at least once.
A card is drawn from a pack of 52 cards. What is the probability of drawing a King, given that the card drawn is a red card?

In a town of 1000 people, 540 are male, 250 are vegetarians, and 170 are male vegetarians. Find the probability that a person selected at random is a vegetarian given that the selected person is a male.

In a factory, machine X, Y, Z produce 30%, 50%, 20% of the total output. The percentage of defective items from them are 1%, 2%, and 1% respectively. If a defective item is drawn, find the probability that it was produced by machine X.
Two dice are thrown. What is the probability that the sum of the numbers is 10 or more?
A bag contains 5 green and 7 blue balls. Two balls are drawn without replacement. Find the probability that one is green and one is blue.
If P(A) = 0.5, P(B) = 0.4 and A and B are independent events. Find P(A ∪ B).
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. How many students failed in both?
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. How many students passed in at least one subject?
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. How many students passed only in Mathematics?
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. How many students passed only in Physics?
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. Find the probability that a student passed in both the subjects.
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. Find the probability that a student failed in both the subjects.
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. Find the probability that a student passed in at least one subject.
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. Find the probability that a student passed in Mathematics only.
In a class of 120 students, 60 passed in Mathematics, 50 passed in Physics and 30 passed in both. Find the probability that a student passed in Physics only.

Among the passengers in a bus, 50% like tea, 60% like coffee, 40% like ice cream. 30% like tea and coffee, 25% like coffee and ice cream, 20% like tea and ice cream. 10% like all three. The percentage of passengers who like tea only is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like coffee only is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like ice cream only is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like coffee and ice cream but not tea is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like tea and ice cream but not coffee is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like at least 2 of the 3 products is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like at most 2 of the 3 products is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like tea or coffee is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like coffee or ice cream is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like tea or ice cream is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like tea but not ice cream is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like coffee but not ice cream is:

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like both tea and ice cream but not coffee is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY

questions.question_text: The percentage of passengers who like at least 2 of the 3 products is:
questions.data_paragraph: SET THEORY - VERY EASY AND EASY
